subject: Languages
title: Martha's Vineyard: Where Everyone Signed
description: A short lesson to help you apply Martha's Vineyard: Where Everyone Signed.

hook.text: On a small island off Massachusetts, deaf and hearing people all used sign language for 200 years.

buildup.text: Martha's Vineyard had an unusually high rate of hereditary deafness from the 1690s to the early 1900s.

discovery.text: Because so many people were deaf, the entire community learned sign â€” hearing and deaf alike.

twist.text: Deaf islanders weren't disabled â€” they were fully integrated. Deafness wasn't even remarkable.

climax.text: Martha's Vineyard proves that disability is partly created by the society, not just the body.

punchline.text: When everyone signs, deafness stops being a disability and becomes a difference.

quiz.question: What was unique about Martha's Vineyard?
options: Both deaf and hearing residents used sign language
